channel.title: murder on Lunaapahkiing Princeton Timetree
channel.description: Recent content in murder on Lunaapahkiing Princeton Timetree

item.title: Funding Ends
item.description: George Morgan White Eyes learns the truth about his fatherâ€™s murder by a white man; Colonel George Morgan leaves for Missouri and recommends to Congress that George Morgan White Eyes continue education elsewhere. George Morgan White Eyes writes a series of petitions to George Washington to have his education funded, but Washington ignores his requests. George Morgan White Eyes eventually relinquishes his efforts and asks for permission to return to Ohio.

item.title: Murder
item.description: Chief White Eyes is shot and killed by an American militia officer, allegedly out of self-defense.

item.title: Prospect Occupation
item.description: Following the murder of Chief White Eyes, a delegation of ten Ohio Delaware leaders and their respective retinues assembles at Prospect Farm to assure the U.S. Government of continued loyalty and friendship. Read more about Prospect Farm at Princeton & Slavery. Read a 1931 description of the 10 Delaware members who came to Prospect during Colonel George Morgan’s tenure of the farm.
